intro: Sacciolepis transbarbata, commonly known as the Transbarbata Sacciolepis, is a flowering plant native to the island of St. Lucia in the Caribbean. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. It thrives in coastal areas and is adapted to saline and well-drained soils. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
